channel.title: Rics NoteBook
channel.description: Studying the Art of Science & the Science of Art

item.title: From Bro House to Powerhouse: Rewiring UF Frats into Energy Gyms and Entrepreneur Hubs
item.description: UF fraternities shouldn’t just be relics of keg culture—they should be kinetic energy hubs, wellness distributors, and business incubators. Imagine frats that power the grid, move medicine, and make money while lifting the future.
item.author: ericdequevedo@gmailcom (Eric deQuevedo)

item.title: Fruit Trees on Every Quad: Why College Campuses Should Feed the Future
item.description: Imagine walking to class and picking a fresh orange, apple, or fig right off a tree. With fruit trees and campus compost systems, universities can feed students, nourish ecosystems, and plant a legacy of regenerative abundance.
item.author: ericdequevedo@gmailcom (Eric deQuevedo)

item.title: Rebuilding UF: A Smarter, Cleaner, More Connected Campus for the Gator Nation
item.description: Its time for the University of Florida to evolve—not just in rankings, but in how it treats its students, energy, environment, and future. From wind-powered walkways to WiFi-driven democracy, this is how UF can become the most innovative and inclusive campus in the country.
item.author: ericdequevedo@gmailcom (Eric deQuevedo)
